mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics module¶

mav_dynamics

  • this file implements the dynamic equations of motion for MAV

  • use unit quaternion for the attitude state

part of mavsimPy

  • Beard & McLain, PUP, 2012

  • Update history:

    12/17/2018 - RWB 1/14/2019 - RWB 12/21 - GND

class mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics.DynamicState(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Struct for the dynamic state

convert_to_numpy() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Converts the state to a numpy object

extract_euler() → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Calculates the euler coordinates from the quaterion values

Returns:

Tuple of euler angles

Return type:

(phi, theta, psi)

extract_state(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] | None = None) → None¶

Initializes the state variables

If no state is given, the defaults will be taken from mav_sim.parameters.aerosonde_parameters

Parameters:

state – Optional state from which to extract the state values

set_attitude_euler(phi: float, theta: float, psi: float) → None¶

Sets the attitude of the state using euler coordinates

Parameters:

  • phi – roll (rotation about i^{v2})

  • theta – pitch (rotation about j^{v1})

  • psi – yaw (rotation about k^v)

class mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics.ForceMoments(force_moment: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]] = array([[0.], [0.], [0.], [0.], [0.], [0.]]))¶

Bases: object

Struct for forces and moments

IND_FX: int = 0¶
IND_FY: int = 1¶
IND_FZ: int = 2¶
IND_L: int = 3¶
IND_M: int = 4¶
IND_N: int = 5¶
to_array() → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Convert the struct to an array of values

Returns:

6x1 array of forces and moments

Return type:

force_moment

class mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics.MavDynamics(Ts: float, state: DynamicState | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Implements the dynamics of the MAV assuming forces and moments are directly input

get_euler() → tuple[float, float, float]¶

Returns the roll, pitch, and yaw Euler angles based upon the state

get_state() → DynamicState¶

Returns the current state in a struct format

Outputs:

DynamicState: The latest state of the mav

update(forces_moments: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], time_step: float | None = None) → None¶

Update states.

Integrate the differential equations defining dynamics. Inputs are the forces and moments on the aircraft.

Parameters:

forces_moments – 6x1 array containing [fx, fy, fz, Mx, My, Mz]^T

class mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics.StateIndices¶

Bases: object

Constant class for easy access of state indices

DOWN: int = 2¶
E0: int = 6¶
E1: int = 7¶
E2: int = 8¶
E3: int = 9¶
EAST: int = 1¶
NORTH: int = 0¶
NUM_STATES: int = 13¶
P: int = 10¶
Q: int = 11¶
QUAT: list[int] = [6, 7, 8, 9]¶
R: int = 12¶
U: int = 3¶
V: int = 4¶
VEL: list[int] = [3, 4, 5]¶
W: int = 5¶
mav_sim.chap3.mav_dynamics.derivatives(state: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]], forces_moments: ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]) → ndarray[tuple[int, ...], dtype[Any]]¶

Implements the dynamics xdot = f(x, u) where u is the force/moment vector

Parameters:

  • state – Current state of the vehicle

  • forces_moments – 6x1 array containing [fx, fy, fz, Mx, My, Mz]^T

Returns:

Time derivative of the state ( f(x,u), where u is the force/moment vector )
